COMMENTS: This is config file for the current relic command
CURRENT_RELIC_COMMAND is a list of the prefix that is used for command
If viewer type only prefix, it will say list of the relic by
format as CURRENT_RELICS_ONE_MESSAGE_DEFAULT of each relic
separate by CURRENT_RELICS_SEPARATOR_MESSAGE_DEFAULT
and finally say as format CURRENT_RELICS_MESSAGE_DEFAULT
If viewer type the slot number (leftmost is 1)
or negative value of the slot number (rightmost is -1)
say as format CURRENT_RELIC_MESSAGE_DEFAULT
<T_VIEWER> is the ID of Twitch viewer typed command
<CR_NUMBER> is the slot of the relic(starts from 1, convert to positive)
<CR_NAME> is the name of relic
<CR_DESC> is the description of relic
<CR_LIST> is the list of parsed relic
CURRENT_RELIC_ENABLED determine whether use this command. true/false
CURRENT_RELIC_ALL_ENABLED determine whether use say all command(without number). true/false
CURRENT_RELIC_ONE_ENABLED determine whether use say one command(with number). true/false
TIMEOUT_GLOBAL is the global cooldown(ms, 1000ms=1second) for this command
TIMEOUT_ALL is the cooldown(ms, 1000ms=1second) for say all command
TIMEOUT_ONE is the cooldown(ms, 1000ms=1second) for say one command, applied for each slot
MAX_LEN is the max length of the description of one relic (2147483647 = infinite)
example of the default, !cr -> '@gyeryak Burning Blood(1), Anchor(2), Vajra(3)
example of the default, !cr 1 -> '@gyeryak (1) Burning Blood: DESC_OF_BURNING_BLOOD(parsed)
example of the default, !cr -1 -> '@gyeryak (3) Vajra: DESC_OF_VAJRA(parsed)
Be careful of the JSON and Regex
